document_title: Pneumoconiosis (dust in the lungs): Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: bui-phoi.json_5_Who is at high risk of getting pneumoconiosis?
subsection_content:
Anyone who comes into direct contact with dust is at risk of breathing it into their lungs, leading to illness. One study found that about 16% of coal miners in the US may suffer from interstitial fibrosis caused by coal dust (3).
Besides, some other risk factors include:
People who smoke regularly;; People exposed to high levels of dust;; People exposed to dust for long periods of time.
People with the habit of smoking have a high risk of getting the disease
